m_szDocTitle: The Cruncher Recycles Plastic Waste Into 3D Printing Filament
m_szDocSumamry: February 12th, 2015 by Jeff McIntire-Strasburg   Any time I’ve seen a new technology meant to bring 3D printing to the masses , my initial response has been: “Do we really need more low-quality plastic crap in our houses?” But I’m excited by rapid prototyping as a much less materially intensive way to design and redesign products, and experiments in the healthcare sector, such as printing replacement organs, are awfully cool. But, of course, all of that testing out and experimenting will involve failures — should those bad prints just go to the landfill? Not if startup Extrusionbot has its way
